notes.text: New Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.6.0 packages are available from the Customer Portal.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.6 is a standalone server, based on the Keycloak project, that provides authentication and standards-based single sign-on capabilities for web and mobile applications.

This release of Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.6.0 serves as a replacement for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.5, and includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are documented in the Release Notes document linked to in the References.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Enhancement Advisory: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.6.0 update

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference

notes.text: A flaw was found in Liquiibase's XMLChangeLogSAXParser() function. It uses SAXParser with no FEATURE_SECURE_PROCESSING set, which could possibly allow XML External Entity (XXE) attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: liquibase: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The impact to Satellite up to 6.11 is very low, as it does not use custom or external XSD in Candlepin's liquibase changelog files. Satellite 6.12 and later versions are not affected by this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

vulnerabilities.title: liquibase: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity
